articles.title: HCA ramps up outpatient growth, sees more acquisition opportunities
articles.summary: Nashville, Tenn.-based HCA Healthcare added about 100 facilities to its outpatient footprint in 2025 and the system heads into 2026 and 2027 with “significant capital in the pipeline” for outpatient development, CEO Sam Hazen said.

articles.title: US life expectancy hits all-time high amid decline in drug overdose deaths
articles.summary: U.S.

articles.title: 10 hospitals, health systems seeking pharmacy leaders
articles.summary: Hospitals and health systems nationwide are seeking pharmacy leaders as the role expands amid drug pricing pressure, supply chain constraints and growing 340B oversight. In 2025, many organizations sharpened their focus on pharmacy as a strategic lever — elevating its role with clinical integration, specialty drug management and cost containment efforts.

articles.title: WSU pharmacists join national telehealth program for Medicare patients
articles.summary: Faculty from Washington State University’s College of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences in Spokane are now providing telehealth services to Medicare patients nationwide through a new collaboration with Praventa Health. More than a dozen WSU pharmacy faculty members are participating in Praventa Health’s telehealth platform, offering counseling and comprehensive medication management, according to a Jan.

articles.title: Penn Medicine rolls out 24/7 virtual primary care
articles.summary: Philadelphia-based Penn Medicine has implemented a 24/7 virtual care model to manage after-hours patient needs across 63 primary care practices in Pennsylvania and New Jersey. The systemwide change eliminates most on-call duties for primary care physicians by routing after-hours calls to a dedicated virtual care team, according to a Jan.

articles.title: 25 recent CMO, CNO moves
articles.summary: Many of the nation’s largest health systems began 2026 with a flurry of clinical executive appointments. Birmingham, Ala.

articles.title: Texas freezes new H-1B applications through May 2027
articles.summary: Texas Attorney General Greg Abbott ordered the state’s agencies and universities to freeze all new H-1B visa petitions through May 2027. In a Jan.

articles.title: Woman sentenced to 6 years for posing as nurse
articles.summary: A woman who repeatedly posed as a registered nurse to gain employment in multiple states has been sentenced to more than six years in federal prison. Leticia Gallarzo, 51, formerly of Wayland, Mich.

articles.title: 7 health systems moving to Epic
articles.summary: A growing number of hospitals are going live on Epic, part of a broader shift that has made the company the dominant player in the U.S.

articles.title: Why Prime invested $104M in its Illinois hospitals in 1 year
articles.summary: Ontario, Calif.-based Prime Healthcare is looking to deepen its Illinois footprint with an asset purchase agreement to acquire Mishawaka, Ind.

articles.title: STAT+: Pharmalittle: We’re reading about AstraZeneca investing in China, an abandoned overdose antidote, and more
articles.summary: AstraZeneca will invest $15 billion in China through 2030 to expand medicines manufacturing and research and development

articles.title: STAT+: ImmunityBio’s Soon-Shiong mischaracterized talks with FDA over cancer drug, sources say
articles.summary: ImmunityBio Chairman Patrick Soon-Shiong mischaracterized talks with the FDA over the company's cancer drug, sources say.

articles.title: STAT+: How Opvee, Indivior’s powerful overdose antidote, went bust
articles.summary: Opvee reverses opioid overdose more quickly than Narcan. It also can cause withdrawal symptoms.

articles.title: With new vaccine schedule secured, RFK Jr. allies head to statehouses
articles.summary: The overhaul of the federal vaccine schedule sent shockwaves through American health care. Now battles over vaccine laws are moving to statehouses across the country.

articles.title: Opinion: Why I decided to share all my health information with ChatGPT Health
articles.summary: “I don’t think people should have to go through 18 years of brain cancer to understand their own health records,” writes Liz Salmi.

articles.title: Opinion: Do pediatricians make large profits from vaccines?
articles.summary: Vaccine critics like to say that pediatricians profit from vaccines. This report found something very different.

articles.title: The healthcare claims system is ready for transformation. Here are 5 ways to prepare in 2026.
Chuck Divita on why 2026 is Teladoc’s ‘execution year’
articles.summary: The CEO sat down with Healthcare Dive to discuss the company’s move to accept insurance at BetterHelp, its M&A strategy and how Teladoc is using artificial intelligence.

articles.title: HCA could lose $1B from ACA subsidy lapse, Medicaid state payment decline
Spring Health to buy Alma as AI rapidly reshapes mental healthcare market
articles.summary: Spring Health, a company that offers digital mental healthcare and navigation services, plans to acquire Alma to expand its offerings and tap into the startup's connections to health plans.

articles.title: CenterWell adopts AI-native athenaOne platform as it expands senior-focused primary care clinics
articles.summary: CenterWell, Humana's senior-focused primary care division, has implemented athenahealth's fully integrated electronic health record with a suite of AI tools across its primary care clinic network.

articles.title: Advocate Health plans $776M increase in total employee compensation for 2026
articles.summary: The country's third-largest nonprofit system, with 167,000 employees and $38 billion in annual revenue, said "competitive" workforce investments like an increased starting minimum wage will benefit both staff and patients.

articles.title: ProMedica signs on with Nomi Health for direct employer contracting
articles.summary: Nomi Health is teaming with Toledo-based ProMedica for the latest expansion of its direct network.

articles.title: Sword Health buys Kaia Health in $285M deal to expand its footprint in US, Germany
articles.summary: Sword Health, a company that provides an AI-first care model, plans to acquire rival Kaia Health for $285 million, the company announced Wednesday.

articles.title: Elevance Health sets 'prudent' 2026 guidance as it navigates ongoing cost, utilization pressures
articles.summary: Elevance Health beat the Street on profit in the fourth quarter of 2025, though a revenue miss generated mixed results.

articles.title: Akido Labs, partners launch AI-powered street medicine program in Bay Area
articles.summary: Akido’s AI-driven platform, ScopeAI, will bolster the capacity of street medicine teams with the goal of keeping unhoused patients healthy and out of hospitals. Several community partners are supporting the program: Future Communities Institute (FCI), Five Keys and Reimagine Freedom.

articles.title: American Academy of Pediatrics' updated immunization schedule rebukes CDC's drastic cutbacks
articles.summary: The pediatric medical group recommends children be vaccinated against 18 diseases, as opposed to the federal government's recent reduction to 11.

articles.title: Employer-focused primary care companies Premise Health, Crossover Health announce merger plans
articles.summary: Premise Health and Crossover Health plan to merge, creating a large employer-focused advanced primary care company serving more than 400 organizations and operating 900 clinics across the country.
